title: ria+ssh without git on the remote server
body:
#### What is the problem?

If I create a ria sibling on a server without git installed, it does not work.

I thought this should be possible because the handbook says:
> On the RIA store hosting infrastructure, only 7z is to be installed, if the archive feature is desired. Specifically, no Git, no git-annex, and no otherwise running daemons are necessary. If the RIA store is set up remotely, the server needs to be SSH-accessible.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

On a client:
```bash
$ datalad create test_remote
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /p/tmp/pflueger/dl-test/test_remote 
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time) 
create(ok): /p/tmp/pflueger/dl-test/test_remote (dataset)
$ cd test_remote/
$ dd bs=1M count=1 if=/dev/random of=test_file
0+1 records in
0+1 records out
115 bytes copied, 0,00027092 s, 424 kB/s
$ datalad save -m 'asdf'
add(ok): /p/tmp/pflueger/dl-test/test_remote/test_file (file)
save(ok): /p/tmp/pflueger/dl-test/test_remote (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
$ datalad create-sibling-ria -s 'sria' ria+ssh://aix:/home/pflueger/sria
[INFO   ] create siblings 'sria' and 'sria-storage' ... 
CommandError: 'ssh -o ControlPath=/home/pflueger/.cache/datalad/sockets/891b01a8 aix 'cd /home/pflueger/sria/177/bda76-5d0c-4bbb-8d9b-ae8a6b366395 && git init --bare'' failed with exitcode 127
bash: git: command not found
```

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

The remote server is an AIX machine without git, git-annex, or datalad.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

I have published a dataset with datalad to gin before, but have not a lot of experience yet.
